paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.phenotype_details: familial cardiomyopathy associated with the V122I mutation
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Among these, the V122I mutation in the TTR gene is the most commonly found amyloidogenic mutation worldwide and is predominantly associated with familial cardiomyopathy in individuals of African descent.

functional_data.summary: The V122I mutation is associated with familial cardiomyopathy.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, it segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The V122I mutation is the most prevalent TTR mutation linked to amyloidosis.
key_quotes: The V122I mutation in the TTR gene is the most commonly found amyloidogenic mutation worldwide and is predominantly associated with familial cardiomyopathy in individuals of African descent.

patients.phenotype: aggressive and highly penetrant systemic amyloidosis

individual_records.phenotype_details: systemic amyloidosis associated with the S52P variant
individual_records.evidence_sentence: On the other hand, the S52P variant is associated with aggressive and highly penetrant systemic amyloidosis.

functional_data.summary: The S52P variant is linked to aggressive systemic amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, it segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The S52P variant is noted for its high penetrance.
key_quotes: The S52P variant is associated with aggressive and highly penetrant systemic amyloidosis.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data extracted from the main text.
